epd_metadata.owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
product_description.hazardous_substances: None listed in Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m3 of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.temporal_representativeness: Data updated within 10 years as required
background_data_sources: Cement supplier data and EPD factors 2022
Cementitious supplementary materials supplier data and Ecoinvent factors 2022
Manufactured mains water invoices and Ecoinvent factors 2022
Admixtures supplier data and Ecoinvent factors 2023

lca_information.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
lca_information.core_processes: External transportation of materials to core processes and internal transport; manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing); treatment of waste and wastewater from manufacturing
lca_information.downstream_processes: Distribution of concrete mixes; installation on site; wastage of construction products; transport and treatment of waste at end of life
lca_information.other_environmental_information: Module D indicates environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from truck and pump; manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms

deconstruction.method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: 100% of product assumed separately collected; delivery distance assumed due to lack of primary data

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete over lifetime (carbonation) not considered in this EPD

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR documents (2024)
Man Yu et al., The Carbon Footprint of Australia's Construction Sector, Procedia Engineering, 2017
disclaimers: Results of environmental impact indicators with high uncertainty or limited experience should be used with care
Ionising radiation indicator excludes effects from nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal underground
GWP-GHG (IPCC AR5) excludes biogenic carbon and indirect radiative forcing
Use of results from modules A1-A3 or A4-A5 without module C may mislead communication and decision-making

contact_information.disclaimer: This publication supersedes all previous literature on this subject. Specifications and details may change. Users must determine suitability. Holcim accepts no liability for loss or damage from use or reliance on this information.
